page.title: 07LEITH - REDEVELOPMENT?
page.content: The solution to Leith's problems has been found in redevelopment. This has been devised to suit the needs of the 20th century industry, commerce and housing. The District Council policy towards this is one of redeveloping existing properties, rather than demolition and rebuilding. The redevelopment is being carried out by both the public and private sectors. The public sector is financed by central government and their agencies, such as the Scottish Development Agency which deals with general redevelopment; the Scottish Special Housing Association has built homes in Leith. The Port of Leith Housing Association has used government grants and loans over the last 10 years to invest, by the end of 1984 over Â£12 million into housing for Leith.
